description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Bodrum" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Bodrum

places.generalDescription: Marina Yacht Club Bodrum is a vibrant venue with stunning sea views, offering a diverse range of bars and restaurants serving both local and international cuisine. For those interested in ancient history, the remains of the Bodrum Mausoleum Museum, also known as the Mausoleum of Halicarnassus, provide a fascinating glimpse into the past.

sources.snippet: Overlooking the historical Bodrum Castle lies the entertainment hub of Bodrum - Bodrum Marina Yacht Club. This is one of the most popular clubs in Bodrum, which is open around the year. Here you can get a spectacular view of the sea and enjoy the beauty of Bodrum Castle with a special Turkish drink by your side.
sources.shortName: Nightlife in Bodrum - 14 Best Places to Experience at Night

sources.snippet: Alternatively, the Marina Yacht Club only employs world famous, award winning chefs who serve delicious meals for two with a continental vibe. With after dinner entertainment in the form of live music, couples sit veranda side in the cool evening air to feast on juicy meat, sumptuous fish, pasta, and dessert.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Honeymoon in Bodrum - from blog

places.name: Marina Yacht Club Bodrum

reviews.text: We went to Marina Yacht Club - the place is absolutely wonderful and unique, with an exceptional view of the yachts. The food was incredibly delicious, and the prices were very reasonable. There was live music, and a person named Serhat provided outstanding service. He is a true professional when it comes to customer satisfaction. I will definitely return to this place - it has become my favorite spot.

Upstairs overlooking the band and marina is a gorgeous setting for dinner. We were way too early as we came for sunset. Sunset isn't visible on this side, so come later as it was very quiet with few tables and live music only starting at 10.30pm, plus it may have been off season (Sept 2024). Bring a jacket as it's windy up there! Staff are kind and helpful.

a good place to listen to live music, but there is a problem. The menu doesn't indicate what's spicy. the waiters run after each other, but do not completely set the table, there are three of us, they brought two forks and three knives, they gave two of us napkins. We sat down at the table, the table was covered in crumbs.

places.address: Marina Yacht Club Milta Bodrum Marina, Çarşı, Neyzen Tevfik Cd. No:5, 48400 Bodrum/Muğla, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Bodrum Castle, also known as the Castle of St. Peter or Petronium, is a historic landmark in Bodrum overlooking the international port. Built in the 15th century by the Knights of Rhodes, it has served various purposes over time including a church and a mosque during the Ottoman Empire. Today, it houses a significant underwater archaeology museum and was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2016.

sources.snippet: Bodrum's magnificent waterfront castle, built by the Knights Hospitaller, dates back to the 15th century. It houses the excellent Museum of Underwater…
sources.shortName: attractions Bodrum Town, Bodrum Peninsula

sources.snippet: If you happen to visit Bodrum, do not miss the Bodrum Castle. In here, you would find a number of interesting things such as bazaar, old – school coffee shops and of course, souvenir stores. However, don’t forget that the castle is more than just a tourist spot as it holds stories even young couples would appreciate.
sources.shortName: 7 Reasons Why Young Couples Should Visit Bodrum, Turkey

sources.snippet: Bodrum Castle, an iconic symbol of the district, ranks as a must-visit destination in Bodrum. Constructed by the Knights of Saint John from 1406 to 1523, the castle stands today in remarkably well-preserved condition. Noteworthy sections within the castle include the English Tower, the French Tower, and the dungeon.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Bodrum

sources.snippet: Peak season in Turkey stretches from around May to September, similar to other European destinations. I visited in the high season in Bodrum and didn’t find it to be too busy or hectic. The daytime temperature was hot, around 33 Celsius or so and it was blue skies and sunny.
sources.shortName: Bodrum Travel Guide- The Best Things to Do in Bodrum,Turkey

sources.snippet: Don’t be fooled into thinking Bodrum is nothing but beaches and clubs. In fact, there are plenty of things to do in Bodrum that are bursting historical intrigue.
sources.shortName: COMPLETE GUIDE TO BODRUM BY THE LOCALS

sources.snippet: While many people visit to relax and party here in the summer, there is a lot to do and see. Here are 10 of the best things to do in Bodrum.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Guide To Bodrum, Turkey

sources.snippet: In the evening, the promenade offers spectacular views of the neon sunset, illuminated stone walls of Bodrum Castle and star-lit skies.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things to Do in Bodrum Beyond the Beaches

places.name: Bodrum Castle

reviews.text: As with many castles this one was also rixh with history. We chose to explore on our own and found it to be a fantastic experience ( we really enjoy castles already and have seen many) but this one was fairly well preserved with many labels. It also includes a museum of a couple shipwrecks that have been partially re constructed which were truly fascinating.  ( Ill say no to buying tickets in advance because it was simple to do with a Visa or Mastercard at the entrance otherwise you must use Turkish Lira currency)

This place is huge and beautiful kept. We spent nearly 3 hours combing through every detail and exhibit. The grounds, museum and setting inside the castle takes you back to life in the country so many years ago. Definitely visit if you are in the Bodrum area. Very less crowds also, so you can really spend some time by yourself. Also, the photos of the harbour from the castle walls will come out so good!

Lovely museum, definitely worth visiting even during summertime thanks to the a/c installed in every exhibition room. The views of the city are incredible and if you get a guide you will be able to learn more about the history of the city.

places.generalDescription: The Bodrum Museum of Underwater Archaeology, located in Bodrum Castle, is a popular tourist attraction. It houses a diverse collection of artifacts from ancient shipwrecks and an extensive display of glass items. The museum provides detailed explanations about the time periods and circumstances surrounding the sinking of these ships, as well as the recovery process for these sunken relics. With Turkey's rich ancient history and numerous coastal battles, the museum continually unveils new exhibits related to underwater exploration.

sources.snippet: At the heart of Bodrum is the castle; this was built from 1402 onwards by the Knights of St John. The Castle is now home to the Museum of Underwater Archeology and contains a number of wrecks that were discovered in the Aegean, as well as a collection of ancient items from the ships. It’s definitely worth spending a morning wandering around the castle grounds.
sources.shortName: Top Things To Do In Bodrum

sources.snippet: The Castle of Saint John is a good place to start with its fantastic Aegean views and Underwater Museum holding the Uluburin shipwreck and other relics found in shipwrecks around the coastline. Many boutique shops and quaint lunch cafes line the cobbled back streets that give a slight impression of the bygone days.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Honeymoon in Bodrum - from blog

sources.snippet: To date, it is one of the most popular spots in Bodrum and also houses the Museum of Underwater Archaeology, which is another must visit for young couples. Now that I already mentioned about the museum, let’s talk about it further.
sources.shortName: 7 Reasons Why Young Couples Should Visit Bodrum, Turkey

sources.snippet: Inside Bodrum Castle, you’ll find the Underwater Archeology Museum, which features a fascinating selection of lagan, which is a nautical term used to describe ship cargo that has sunk to the sea floor.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things to Do in Bodrum Beyond the Beaches
COMPLETE GUIDE TO BODRUM BY THE LOCALS

places.name: Bodrum Museum Of Underwater Archaeology

reviews.text: Amazing views, it takes about 2 hours to walkthrough entire castle and museums. Unfortunately very expensive prices to enter museums and historical sites for tourists. Great views though.

Worth a visit if you're into archeology. Entry fee is on the pricey side. Some of the exhibits inside the towers aren't marked clearly until I saw someone coming out the door. Once inside there are some interesting exhibits but it was a nice way to cool off.

Lots of viewpoints for some nice photos. There's a cafe and museum shop onsite.

No air conditioning working in the exhibit areas.
Very expensive entry fee but not much to see.

sources.snippet: You can take a ferry to Bodrum from nearby Greek islands such as Kos or Rhodes. Check the ferry schedules and routes for the most convenient option.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A 5 day romantic trip to Bodrum, Turkey

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) The daylong boat tour was both relaxing and fun. Swimming in Kızıl Burnu was an unforgettable experience. The food was very filling, and we received friendly service throughout the day. Definitely one of the best things to do during your Bodrum vacation.

(Original)
Gün boyu süren tekne turu hem dinlendirici hem de eğlenceliydi. Kızıl Burun'da yüzmek benim için unutulmaz bir deneyimdi. Yemekler gayet doyurucuydu. Tüm gün boyunca güler yüzlü bir hizmet aldık. Bodrum tatilinde yapılacak en güzel aktivitelerden biri kesinlikle.

(Translated by Google) We took the sunset cruise, and the views were incredible. The boat was comfortable, and the captain was very experienced and friendly. We felt very comfortable because all the safety precautions were taken. If we ever return to Bodrum, we will definitely take a tour from here.

(Original)
Gün batımı turuna katıldık ve manzara inanılmazdı. Tekne konforluydu, kaptan çok tecrübeli ve güler yüzlüydü. Tüm güvenlik önlemleri alındığı için kendimizi çok rahat hissettik. Tekrar Bodrum'a gelirsek mutlaka buradan tur alacağız.

(Translated by Google) Everyone was very pleased with our family tour. The kids had a great time, too. The attentive staff made us feel very comfortable. The boat was clean and comfortable.

(Original)
Ailecek çıktığımız turda herkes çok memnun kaldı. Çocuklar da çok eğlendi. Personel ilgisi sayesinde kendimizi çok rahat hissettik. Tekne temiz ve konforluydu.

places.generalDescription: Avlu Bodrum Bistro & Bar is situated in a charming 160-year-old stone building, offering a blend of Turkish and Mediterranean cuisine. The restaurant exudes an elegant ambiance, making it an ideal choice for a romantic dinner or special celebration. Despite recent changes in ownership affecting the menu, the establishment has been praised for its excellent service and delectable dishes.

sources.shortName: Bodrum Travel Guide- The Best Things to Do in Bodrum,Turkey

places.name: Avlu Bodrum Bistro & Bar

reviews.text: Great dinner experience in a cute backstreet of Bodrum. We had mushroom risotto, shrimps with tomato sauce and salmon. Presentation and taste was all great. Suggested for people who wants to have a cozy dinner experience and wants to escape the touristy Bodrum main streets. Also the bathroom was fresh and loaded with hygiene products. We will definitely visit them if we ever come to Bodrum again.

Cozy small restaurant in center of the old city of Bodrum. Prices quite high for that small space and simple interior. Best to visit in winter for any special occasion, so you can enjoy chimney. Definitely suggest to go once just to catch good atmosphere and Bodrum vibe. Wouldn't repeat, once is enough.

Turkey in general has amazing food and you can't go wrong in many places BUT…this place is off the charts. I live in NY and fine dining is easy to come by, so finding a restaurant overseas tends to make us for higher end reviews-this spot over delivers. The staff was not pushy because they understand their quality. The bartender was creative and drinks were delicious. The chef-WOW! It's hard to find a flaw and the creativity with flavors was done to perfection. Make time to stop by for a drink or dinner-you won't be disappointed!

places.address: Çarşı, Sanat Okulu Cd. No:14, 48400 Bodrum/Muğla, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Located in the beautiful Gumbet, just a short distance from Bodrum center, Annalivia Restaurant offers a relaxed dining experience with stunning views of the Aegean Sea. The restaurant's blue and white decor exudes a Mediterranean vibe, creating an instantly calming atmosphere. Known for its impressive steaks and generous portions, the diverse menu also features dishes like peppercorn steaks, Mexican chicken, and turkey.

sources.shortName: Bodrum Travel Guide- The Best Things to Do in Bodrum,Turkey

places.name: ANNALIVIA RESTAURANT GUMBET

reviews.text: That place is spectacular! Great food, great view, kind staff, very nice owner. There is really nothing to complain. Local food, local wines, but also other options.

Just back from a week in gumbet. Visited Annalivia 3 times for Dinner. We have been here many times over the years and it never dissapoints, by far the best restaurant in the area. The staff are very welcoming and attentive, the restaurant itself is so clean and spacious with amazing views and a lovely breeze in the evening. There is lots on the menu, something to suit everyone. Would recommend the steak, plank chicken, kofte, cokertme and spicy dip and hummus! The desserts are delicious too, souffle being the firm favourite. They also make a fab daiquiri. Thanks to Maria, Feridun and all the staff for taking care of us x

Ate twice here during our trip (was highly recommended)
Great views from its elevated location, really friendly and attentive staff and the best food we enjoyed on our holiday. The lamb chops are to die for (mint sauce excellent also).

places.address: Gümbet, Şakir Esendemir Sk. No:6/B, 48409 Bodrum/Muğla, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Karnas Vineyards, sprawling across 165 hectares, is a picturesque estate featuring vineyards and olive trees. Established in 2005 by the Ismen family, it was Turkey's first producer of zinfandel grapes. The winery offers sustainable wines and a delightful multicourse tasting menu. Visitors can enjoy wine tastings while taking in panoramic views of the fields.
places.name: Karnas Vineyards

reviews.text: This place is too good to be true. Amazing ambiance, delicious wines, some of the cheeses in the cheese platter were even handmade by the chef and the food is also just perfect. Staff is extremely friendly. Totally worth a visit, you won't be sorry!

Had the most amazing time at Karnas vineyards. It was my mum's birthday and the team went above and beyond, preparing an incredible table for us for the wine tasting, beautifully decorated. Nibbles and cheeses were all delicious, and so were the wines! Compliments to the chef who makes the most amazing food - she made a birthday cake for us that was one of the best cakes we've ever had, catering to our wishes. They looked after us so well and the setting itself is tranquil and beautiful. We will be back (to try all of the food next time too!)! A must visit for anyone traveling to Bodrum.

I recently booked the food and wine pairing dinner at Karnas Vineyards through Viator, and it was a memorable experience. The food was delicious, the wine was fantastic, and the service was excellent. Dilya gave us a short but interesting tour of the winery, sharing its history and operations.

The drive from Bodrum was about an hour each way, and while the cost was $270 for two people, I'm still on the fence about whether it was worth it. The experience was great, but it's one of those things you have to decide for yourself.

sources.snippet: Perched atop the hills surrounding Bodrum Bay, Kafedaki offers a dining experience that's both intimate and grand. The restaurant, with its traditional indoor setting adorned with antique furnishings, exudes warmth and authenticity. The outdoor terrace, illuminated by soft lantern lights, provides a panoramic view of Bodrum, making it an ideal spot for romantic dinners.
sources.shortName: Unique Cuisine and Magical Views

places.name: Kafedaki

reviews.text:
Date night! Beautiful view. Cosy and intimate atmosphere. Lovely music. Indoor and outdoor seating. The customer service was fantastic. Beautiful lovely people.

FOOD WAS AMAZING 👏🏾 There was nothing I tried, that I didn't like. HIGHLY recommend the Beef Stroganoff. Borek is the nicest I've had and they give a good portion size as a starter too.

It was so good, that we took our mother's, sisters, sons, nieces and nephews here for our final meal in Bodrum the following day.

When we return to Bodrum, we will definitely be coming back to Kafedaki.

Maybe that's Life..

Enjoy simple things, a coffee, a look, a smile!

A luxurious restaurant with a wonderful view, it took 40 minutes to arrive from the Cape Hotel, and the road was not easy to drive I  I recommend going by taxi.
It is one of the best restaurants to watch the sunset with a view of the city.
The service is also always friendly and efficient. The staff is always happy to help you choose food and drink, and they always check in on you to make sure you're happy with your meal.
I arrived before the restaurant opened but the owner of the restaurant let me in before the restaurant opened.
The atmosphere  is inviting. The restaurant is clean and well maintained, and the music is at a good volume.
they have an outdoor and indoor sitting, but like outdoor sitting, it's very lovely with unforgettable views.
The food was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. I started with the appetizer, which was cooked to perfection and served with a delicious citrus beurre blanc sauce. For my main course, I had  a piece of meat which was melt in your mouth tender and served with a side of truffled mashed potatoes and asparagus, and I finish my lovely dinner with the locals sweet it's was very delicious.
Overall, I had a wonderful dining experience at  Kafedaki. The food was excellent, the service was top-notch, and the atmosphere was perfect. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a special dining experience.

places.address: Cumhuriyet, Alarga Sk. No:4/1, 48440 Bodrum/Muğla, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Deve Beach, located in the Bodrum peninsula, is a top-notch destination that stands out for its pristine sandy shore and crystal-clear waters. Unlike other beaches in the area, it boasts a rare absence of rocks both on the beach and in the water. The calm and shallow sea makes it an ideal spot for families with children and non-swimmers to enjoy a safe swim.
places.name: Deve Beach

reviews.text: 🐪🐫🐪 We came from the sea and anchored. The beach is suitable for children. The view was nice. I didn't go into the sea. It is a very crowded beach… The piers can be used as a jumping ramp. I heard that there is a fee to enter this beach. I don't know the price but if you ask whether it is worth paying, it seems worth it... 🐫🐪🐫

SUN SET BEACH
The Staff are so polite. Price is accountable.
It's the nicest beach in the bodrum/gumbet/bitez area , white sands and clear blue sea. Each sunbed section has it's own bar and cafe behind it.

places.generalDescription: Located on the Bodrum coast, Moonlight Bar has been a beloved spot since 1989. It offers an enchanting seafront setting and draws in both locals and tourists year-round. The bar becomes a winter haven with its romantic ambiance, making it perfect for couples. Situated near Bodrum Castle, it is known for its serene atmosphere and stays open until dawn. With high-quality service and stunning views of the sea, this bar is a must-visit when in Bodrum.

sources.snippet: Established in 1989, the Moonlight  Bar in Bodrum is one of the most beautifully located bars in Bodrum, overviewing the beauty of the sea right in the front. Located on the Bodrum coast, the bar serves locals and tourists all year round and winter attracts particularly more crowds. The romantic ambience of the setting is perfect for couples.
sources.shortName: Nightlife in Bodrum - 14 Best Places to Experience at Night

places.name: Moonlight Bar

reviews.text: Definitely the bar you want to be in when in Bodrum, the view an d the coziness of the place is just amazing, so much that my wife and I would like to return at a much slower pace and spend a couple of weeks sitting in our favorite spot while drinking beer or wine and enjoying the clam and beautiful view. Yes, I said calm in a very busy place full of people, it is just that our senses gets rid of the noise and we found peace in this place.
Cool place with a great view. Employees were so polite and nice. I am very satisfied. But they need to enhance their dessert menu.

When life gives you lemons. You make some cocktails !

Service was great, very friendly. The place is smallish (but so are all the other places in that area).

It has an amazing view of the castle and cocktails were expensive but delicious.

places.address: Çarşı, Dr. Alim Bey Cd., 48400 Bodrum/Muğla, Türkiye

sources.snippet: Who doesn’t want a romantic dinner in a beautiful place with your loved one, right?. What’s good about Bodrum is that it has a number of places where you can have a relaxing and romantic meal.
sources.shortName: 7 Reasons Why Young Couples Should Visit Bodrum, Turkey

reviews.text: I love it, it s really cute place, attention in restaurants is nice, you can drink coffee, tea, cocktails, Beers and smoothies in the same place😅 100% recommended

I used this port to go from Bodrum to Kos and back. It was the first ferry. I got there an hour and fifteen minutes early, so I didn't have to wait in line for check-in. I went straight from the check-in to customs and passport control. There I had to wait for customs to open, which took approximately 40 minutes. There was shade but few places to sit. There was no delay in departure. Customs at Kos was quick. I got to the port 1 hour before on the way back. I spent 15 minutes in line for passport control. Fortunately, there was shade available. Then I found myself in a small area with benches, all of which were occupied, where all the passengers had to wait for the ferries to arrive. The entire process took me 40 minutes or a bit more. Once my ferry arrived and disembarked the passengers, I got in, took a seat, and we departed 10 minutes later. Passport control at Bodrum was quick.

The port and the establishments (coffeehouse for ex) are overpriced, difficult and expensive to park and all in all not very polite people. They made the walking to customs longer so you have to pass by the shops that sell generic nonsense. Ferry offices are efficient and quick. Still a better option than the castle but they milk you, knowing that.

places.generalDescription: Sultan - Traditional Turkish Bath, located adjacent to the south wall and built in 1895 during the prison period, showcases the Ottomans' service for prisoners. The bath includes an entrance, cooling room, hot room, and boiler room. Additionally, it is part of Bodrum Museum of Underwater Archaeology which houses artifacts from shipwrecks and ancient cities. Visitors have praised their experience at Sultan - Traditional Turkish Bath for its friendly staff, reasonable prices, and professional masseurs.

sources.shortName: 7 Reasons Why Young Couples Should Visit Bodrum, Turkey

places.name: Sultan - Traditional Turkish Bath

reviews.text: Booked this via our local Bartender at our apartments. Cost £25 each for 4 of us to have a sauna, Haman and a half hour massage. They tried the hard sell of coffee, bacon, lemon etc massages but you have to politely decline. Well worth the cost and had transport to and from the Haman included.

We booked this through our travel agent and it was sold to this on the premise that if we booked two excursions, we would get “free Turkish bath”.
We were encouraged to go at the beginning of our trip and we were offered multiple times to go so it seemed like a no brainer.

On arrival we were taken into a dimly lit room and were presented with a menu of treatments include massages.
As we were a party of 2, I politely declined as I just felt something was off. And immediately the managers face changed as if he was pissed off.

We were then offered a package for 2 which worked out around 60€.
When we agreed he went back to his smiley friendly persona which just added to my anxiety.

You also felt you were obliged to take it as it seemed too good to decline.
So we agreed however, as we were offered a free Turkish bath. I didn't bring enough funds as I didn't feel I needed to carry much cash.

The venue itself doesn't have a separate changing room for men and women. Everything is shared.
There wasn't anything discussion if we would wanted a female therapist or not so all the services we received were by men.

We were told to go into the sauna and steam room with a man just standing outside and every time I came out he would just come over to me but provided no direction or instructions.
It just felt strange.

As waited for our massage we had to go upstairs and wait on the terrace which was very strange. It would have been nice for them to have a better set up to ensure comfortable as opposed to just sitting in a towel on a mat.

The massage therapists were women however there's no sight of them around unless you book a massage.
Just a strange vibe. Not what you expect when you go to a place like this and intend to have a relaxing experience.

I spoke with our holiday rep about this and shared my concerns.

Went for the hamam followed by a hour and twenty minute deep tissue massage including head and face as well as feet. It was one of the best massages I've ever had. Bushra the lady who looked after me was fantastic. She took note of my injuries and knew exactly how to proceed. My friend had the medical massage and had a fantastic massage too. The establishment is clean, very friendly and highly recommended. Going back later in the week for another. The prices are really good. Thank you so much.

places.address: Gümbet, Yel Değirmeni Cd. No:3/A, 48400 Bodrum/Muğla, Türkiye
